text: They are monsters who happen to look like the rest of us – or, in Ted Bundy’s case, even better. Yet they lost their humanity and believed that killing people was their mission. As heinous as their crimes were, and even when they confessed their guilt, justice wasn’t denied. That’s the thankless, exhausting job of defending the indefensible. Attorneys for infamous criminals tell their stories in Oxygen’s four-part documentary series In Defense Of, premiering Monday, June 25. These lawyers are true believers in the justice system, though not necessarily in their clients’ innocence.
title: “In Defense Of”: Oxygen Series Looks at Lawyers Who Defend the Indefensible
